benchmark_details.name: A Debate-Driven Experiment on LLM Hallucinations and Accuracy
benchmark_details.overview: This study investigates the phenomenon of hallucination in LLMs through a debate-like interaction among multiple GPT-4o-Mini models. One model generates false answers while others respond truthfully, aiming to assess the impact of misinformation on model performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze how misinformation affects the outputs of large language models during inter-model interactions and improve their robustness.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Fixed number of debaters and single type of saboteur strategy.

data.annotation: Questions with one correct and one incorrect answer

methodology.calculation: Percentage accuracy calculated from the total number of correct answers.
methodology.interpretation: Models' performance evaluated based on their ability to discern accurate from false information.
methodology.validation: Through iterative debates among various configurations of model personas.
